column2: evidential: I intuit... / I suspect...
but
column3: Compared to {je} and {ku'i} separately this compound more closely corresponds to English 'but', which has meanings of both a conjunction and a discursive.

column2: logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.
$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.

column3: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].
$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval).  See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
column3: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}).  See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).
column3: Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}).  See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) feels/has pride in/about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
column3: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone.  See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
column3: Also lute, viola, cello.  See also {zgike}.

$x_1$ is the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the ... captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to $x_2$ (subject, entity, vehicle, domain), connected by intermediate steps $x_3$.
column3: If $x_2$ is an entity, then $x_1$ is $x_2$'s boss' boss' boss' … boss. In the U.S. military, the President of the United States (in the capacity of Commander-in-Chief) is the jatny'utka of every member of the military along some graph-path/hierarchy of command. This word is a {brapagjvo} due to the presence of the {zevla} {veljvo} ".{utka}".

column3: This is a vessel which floats on the surface of a sufficiently large body of water. {bloti} is too vague/general for this specific sense (for example, a spaceship ({kesyblo}) is arguably also a bloti, even though it is nothing like a jaursfeblo in its actual mechanics). {liksfeblo} is more general (not designed only for water surfaces); {flublo} is more general still, possibly encompassing airplanes, hot-air balloons, etc. Use {jirblo} for submarines/submersibles/U-boats/etc. (for any liquid).

$x_1$ (object/person) uses up/depletes/consumes/[wastes] $x_2$=$xa_2$ [resource] with event $x_3$=$xa_1$

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum.

$x_1$ seems to be the case to cognizer $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a test for determining whether $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$ and $x_2$ have the same truth value; either both or none of $x_1$ and $x_2$ is true
column5: both or none;if and only if

column2: $x_1$ proves / provides evidence for / demonstrates the truth of $x_2$ (du'u) to audience $x_3$

$r_1$ is measured in algerian dinar (د.جDZD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Algerian monetary system $r_3$.
$x_1$ is the truth value / degree of truth of $x_2$ (bridi) by epistemology/metaphysics $x_3$
$sin_1$ signals whether $sin_3$=$sis_1$ should stop; $sin_1$ is a traffic light
$g_1$ ties $j_1$ in a knot.
$j_1$=$j_2$=$n_1$ is a pretzel made from grains $n_2$.
$c_1$=$j_1$ is offended/[feels hurt pride] about $j_2$ (abstraction).
$x1$=$j1$=$d1$=$c1$ boasts/brags $x2$=$j2$=$c2$ (text) to audience $x3$=$c3$ via medium $x4$=$c4$
$f_1$=$j_1$ defeats $f_2$=$j_3$ in competition $f_3$=$j_4$.
$u_1$ is a checkbox in user interface $u_2$.
column3: The definition includes tri-state checkboxes as well. See also: {gribatke zei uidje}, {uidje}.

column2: $x_1$ is a pope of religion/patriarchy $x_2$.
$x_1$ cooks/prepares some food satisfying $x_2$ (ka), by doing $x_3$ (event)

$x_1$ is the ISO designation/result/standard/code for topic $x_2$ applied to specific case/individual/group/thing $x_3$ according to rule/ISO specification $x_4$ published by/according to mandating organization $x_5$ (default: ISO)
column3: Theoretically, the standard organization/body could be other than ISO, but it should be prominent and/or international (and internationally recognized) in scope and nature; in such a case, replace each occurrence of "ISO" in the definition with the appropriate name/designation/title (of the organization, etc.). x1 need not be a name-designation/code (it could be the result of any rule), although it likely will commonly be so. Examples of possible x2-filling sumti: code-designations for language, country, currency, etc.. For an entity with a given code, use {te javniso} or {te se javniso} (specifying the type of entity being designated by use of the appropriate terbri j2); for a given ISO rule, consider {ve javniso}; for the organization ISO, consider {xe javniso}. See also: {linga}, {landa}, {rucni}, {jvinjiata}, {jvinjica'o}. This word is the fu'ivla version of: {jviso}; equivalent to {jvaiso} (for slightly abbreviated form that preserves some pronunciations of "ISO").

column2: $x_1$ is a taboo forbidding $x_2$ (event) within community $x_3$
$x_1$ is not rightly able to apprehend the kind of confusion of ideas that could provoke such a question as $x_2$
column3: Credit for the English definition goes to Charles Babbage (1791-1871)

column2: $x_1$ is a kiwifruit (genus Actinidia) of species/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$ is guitar with plectrum $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a nyckelharpa [traditional swedish string instrument] with bow $x_2$.
x$_1$ is a pipa.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought always true.
column3: Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: j + jetnu + A.

column2: discursive: \n{je'u } - truth\n{je'u nai} - falsity.
$x_1$ applies for job $x_2$ to $x_3$ in form $x_4$.
column3: The $x_3$ is likely the future employer. The $x_4$ can be used to say "apply online" or "apply by mail". See also {jibri}, {gasnu}, {cpedu}.

column2: $x_1$ perceives that $x_2$ is the case (inference from perception).
$x_1$ is a trefoil knot (shape/object) with characteristics $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily mathematical. Chirality, tightness, etc. may be specified in the x2 terbri. See also:  {trifoli},  {spartrifoli}

column2: $x_1$ is a shamisen with plectrum/bachi $x_2$
$x_1$ is sitar with plectrum $x_2$.
x$_1$ is an erhu with bow $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a walnut of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is Aquarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
column3: From {djacu}, {barfle}, {gasnu}. Aquarius is identified as "The Great One" in the Babylonian star catalogues and represents the god Ea himself, who is commonly depicted holding an overflowing vase. In the Greek tradition, the constellation became represented as simply a single vase from which a stream poured down.

column2: $x_1$ is Scorpius [astronomical constellation]/Scorpio [astrological sign].
column3: The Babylonians called this constellation the 'Scorpion'. In Greek Mythology there are plenty of  myths associated with Scorpio.

column2: na'e fancuka modal: no matter (indirect question)...
column3: Used with {du'u} and an indirect question. If the question type is {xu} then it is synonymous with some construction using the U truth function, e.g. "mi pendo do ja'u lo du'u xu kau do ricfu" = "mi pendo do i ju do ricfu". In fact it should not be used with {xu} since the U truth function is much shorter. It is designed to be used with all other question types. For example, "mi na kakne lo ka smusku kei ja'u lo du'u ma kau bangu", for which there only exists the paraphrase: "no da poi bangu zo'u mi kakne lo ka smusku kei bau da". It is also designed to be used with a {ni} or {jei} abstraction ("jei" in this case being mostly synonymous with "du'u xu kau"), e.g. "mi ba jinga ja'u lo ni lo drata cu troci". See also: {du'u}, {na'e}, {fancuka}, {ni}, {jei}, {u}, {ju}, {gi'u}, {gu'u}, {gu}.

column2: unary mathematical operator: length/number of components/terms of/in object/array/formal string/sequence/word/text in some alphabet/base/basis which includes each digit; number of digits/components/entries
column3: For a numerical string, the number of digits are counted. For a tuple/vector/array/matrix/tensor, the number of entries/conponents is counted. Not literally the number of symbols used, but the number of meaningful "spots" occupied; for example "(1,0)" uses five characters, but its length is just 2 (for "1" and then "0"); this is due to the fact that formal representation may vary but the amount of information conveyed must remain constant. Note that digit strings are essentially considered to be vectors in the basis of powers of the base.
column5: array formal length;number of components;number of digits;number of entries;numerical string formal length;tuple formal length;vector formal length

column2: attitudinal modifier: \n{jau'i} - extra properly, primly, "by the book"\n{jau'inai} - rushing things, half-assing.
column3: For example, "mi setca jau'i lo lante lo tanxe" might be neatly placing it in, "jau'icu'i" is just dropping it normally, and "jau'inai" is sorta apathetically tossing it in there. ".a'ijau'i" is careful effort, ".a'ijau'inai" is frantic/messy effort.

column2: Break in speech in order to demonstrate something in a nongrammatical or nonlinguistic way.
column3: Terminates via ".{i}". Can be followed by a list of words (connected perhaps via "{ce}"), or a picture, or a physical mimicking/charade of actions or a pointing of a finger. Useful for asking about how to say a certain thing (which can be indicated or acted out) or for memes; in writing, it would often be expressed via a colon (":") in English. It would be used for, at the very least, the final colon in the caption to this image: https://photos.app.goo.gl/M6y4fhCy32sgi5No8 , but possibly for the others as well. Neither expression on either side of this word (from the immediately previous ".i" or the beginning of the text, whichever is closer, to the immediately following ".i" or the end of the text, whichever is closer) need be grammatical; the information which is conveyed subsequent to this word may not even be linguistic.

column2: lambda quantifier: binds a lambda variable.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought always false.
column3: Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: j + jitfa + A.

column2: attitudinal scope modifier: marks following attitudinal/UI-cluster as applying to the last lexical unit
column3: Part of a proposal to redefine attitudinals/UI-clauses as being inherently ambiguous in scope; placing ji'au before the UI-clause (e.g. ji'au ui) will restore and emphasize the original functionality of UI-clauses attaching to the last lexical unit. See {i'au}, {toi'e}, {fu'e}, {fu'o}. Closable with {toi'o}.

column2: x$_1$ is violin/fiddle/ with bow $x_2$.
$x_1$ is violin concerto number $x_2$ in key $x_3$ composed by $x_4$ performed by/at $x_5$( event).
$x_1$ is violin/fiddle/ with bow $x_2$.
discursive: continuing/extending/belaboring the point
job descriptor: the one which does …
discursive: returning to or correcting a previous point, moving back in the conversation/discourse
column5: returning to previous point in discourse

column2: even
column3: Used to indicate an intense additional case or intense additional cases. ex.) lo xagji cribe cu citka lo cinki ku ji'a sai (A hungry bear will eat even insects.)

column2: $x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.
column3: Working for another (= {selplijibri}).  See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

column2: $x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects).  See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
column3: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.

See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

(cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).

$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).

column2: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
column3: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column3: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column3: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column3: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column3: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column3: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column3: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column3: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column3: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column3: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
column3: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol.  See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
column3: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column3: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column3: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column3: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column3: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column3: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
column3: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
column3: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
vocative: \n{ki'e} - thanks\n{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
{klani} modal, 1st place (amount)                   quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
{klesi} modal, 1st place (scalar set)               in/of category ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...

attitudinal modifier: 
{le'o} - aggressive
{le'ocu'i} - passive
{le'onai} - defensive.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.
{zmadu} modal, 1st place (a greater)                exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
{mleca} modal, 1st place (a lesser)                 undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
*$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column3: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column3: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column3: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

column2: $x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column3: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
column3: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

column2: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
column3: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
column3: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

column2: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
column3: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column2: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$
column3: Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and 心 (romaji: kokoro).

column2: $x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$
column3: This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.

column2: $x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition)
$x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
column3: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

column2: $x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development
$x_1$ is the home galaxy (default: Milky Way) of object/group/entity/race/vel sim. $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a lily [Lilium] of species/strain $x_2$
$x_1$ is a speakable language used by persons $x_2$
column3: A narrower term than {bangu}, is limited to speakable, usable in dialogues languages used by persons ({lo} {prenu}). Doesn't include languages with information transferred one-way (languages of road signs), doesn't include computer programming languages that are not speakable between two persons.

column2: $x_1$ is a microörganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
column3: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

column2: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
column3: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

column2: (moved to "{matxe}") $x_1$

$x_1$ is magnetism/magnetization (or magnetic charge or magnetic current; or part of a magnetic dipole) in/on/of/produced by/evinced by/associated with $x_2$ (monopole or a dipole, taken in whole or just as a single side/part/pole thereof) of polarity/quantity $x_3$ (default: positive, which indicates magnetic-south in English).
column3: If the signum of $x_3$ is positive, then the charge being referred to is what English speakers call "magnetic-south (pole)"; if it is negative, then the referent is what English speakers call "magnetic-north (pole)". This definition is modelled on that of "{dikca}", which it is intended to parallel. If one does not prefer this gismu, one probably can use "{maktcaxe}" as an equivalent/synonym, but that word uses another experimental gismu ("{tcaxe}") in its veljvo. Replaces "{matce}" due to {gimkamsmikezypro}.

column2: $x_1$ meditates about $x_2$ using practice/method/study $x_3$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
column3: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

column2: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
column3: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

column2: $x_1$ transitions to state $x_2$ from state $x_3$
$x_1$ wants to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$
column3: ka-version of {djica}, that strengthens the relationship between $x_1$ and the property.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the quantity of specimens in the domain of discourse that satisfy the property $x_2$
column3: Predicate equivalent of {da}. It enables rendering a quantifier's scope as a nested bridi level, and to terminate this scope explicitly by closing the sub-bridi. Synonymous with {dzadza}.

column2: $x_1$ is close to having property/almost has property/is/does almost $x_2$ (ka)
$x_1$ goes to (the place to) have property $x_2$
$x_1$ measures, determinates (by sensorial examination) that property $x_2$ is satisfied by $x_3$.
$x_1$ (agent) changes $x_2$ to state $x_3$ (ka) from state $x_4$ (ka).
$x_1$ chooses/selects $x_2$ from $x_3$ (set) for purpose $x_4$ (property).
column3: Under one interpretation, $cuxna_2$ must be a proposition and $cuxna_3$ must be a set of propositions, meaning cuxna is more similar to "decide". This word is equivalent to "cuxna lo du'u ckaji", and allows us to avoid implicit sumti raising with cuxna.

column2: $x_1$ is far from being $x_2$ (ka)
$x_1$ gives/confers property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
column3: Or: $x_1$ makes $x_3$ exhibit $x_2$. Essentially equal to something like {selkaigau}.

column2: $x_1$ thinks/opines that $x_2$ is/does $x_3$ (ka) under grounds $x_4$
$x_1$ considers $x_2$ to have quality $x_3$ (ka) ; $x_2$ qualifies as / counts as being $x_3$ according to $x_1$
being $x_1$ (ka) is part of being $x_2$ (ka)
column3: Or "$x_2$ implies $x_1$", but stronger than the logical sense; this word is definitional or essentialistic, and implies that if something stopped being $x_1$, it'd stop being $x_2$. See {kai'a}, {bi'ai}, {nibli}, {jinzi}

column2: $s_1$ is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$
$x_1$=$xa_1$ is an avatar/physical embodiment of property/force $x_2$=$c_2$ (ka); $x_1$ is $x_2$ incarnate.
$x_1$ needs to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$
column3: ka-version of {nitcu}, that strengthens the relationship between $x_1$ and the property.

column2: $x_1$ is a calculator / computer / reckoning machine computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$
$t_1$=$k_2$ is a cupboard for storing $t_2$, made of $t_3$, with shelves $k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a program / automaton calculating/reckoning/computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$
$x_1$ is (or is made of/from) a quantity of spermaceti (spermaceti wax/oil).
$c_1$=$k_4$ is an excavator/power shovel for digging in $k_3$, operated by $k_1$=$c_3$.
$s_1$ is a sob/sobbing produced by $k_1$ with tears $k_2$ about/for reason $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is a teardrop wept by $x_2$ for reason $x_3$.
$b_1$=$k_1$ is an eyeball (body part) of $k_2$.
$x_1$ is the pupil of the eye of $x_2$
$x_1$ is the iris of the eye of $x_2$
$x_1$ is an iris of color $x_2$ as perceived by $x_3$ under viewing conditions $x_4$; $x_2$ is $x_1$'s eye color.
$x_1$'s eye(s)/iris(es) is/are hazel as perceived by $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
column3: Hazel in this context is a brown and/or gold color that is mixed with or has a tint of green (or vice-versa). Really, only objects that have qualities similar to eye irises can be hazel; other combinations of brown and green do not necessarily constitute hazel (rather, they are often a muddy green or a mossy brown), but if the object has these qualities sufficiently, it may qualify. The point is that not all brown-greens are hazel. This color is distinct from amber.

column2: $c_1$ is a dung beetle [dung-eating arthropod] of species/breed $c_2$.
column3: A beetle (or, metaphorically, other arthropod) whose diet primarily consists of the feces of other animals.

column2: $v_1$=$k_2$ defecates/shits/poos.
$g_1$ is an eyelid of eye $k_1$=$g_2$.
$ke_1$ is an eyelash (body part) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$.
$x_1$=$k_2$=$g_1$ winks/blinks
$x_1$ is a longan berry (Dimocarpus longan) of type $x_2$
column3: See {kanla}, {jbari}. Named for superficial similarity of the peeled fruit to an eye, as paralleled by the Chinese name, 龙眼 (lóngyǎn, lit. "dragon's eye").

column2: $ke_1$ is an eyebrow (supraorbital ridge) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$=$m_2$.
$x_1$=$v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2$=$v_1$.
$x_1$ is a surrounding cover/curtain that surrounds the eye structure of $x_2$
column3: This can include eye stalks (if the eye can be retracted into/enveloped by the surrounding tissue), etc.; it might include eye lids, although it is arguable that they do not really "surround" the eye. A purpose of the curtain must be to cover the eye, not just encase it. Essentially, this must be a circular/ringlike/sphincter eyelid.

column2: $x_1$ is an eyewear or are eyeglasses
$x_1$ hunts another which hunts another which ... which hunts another which hunts $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$v_1$=$k_2$ weeps/lacrimates tear(s) $v_2$ from $v_3$ via means/route $v_4$.
$k_1$ is the greatness/majesty/splendour/magnificence/grandeur of $b_1$ according to standard $b_3$.
$k_1$ is a security condition of $b_1$ protecting $b_2$ from threat $b_3$.
column3: When used as "security", x3 is a planned threat. "security" is comparable to "safety" ({kamnu'a}), "reliability" ({kamylacri}), and "continuity" ({kamra'i}).

column2: $k_1$ is quality/property exhibited by $b_1$ of being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.
$x_1$ is blueness
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $x_1$=$k_1$ is the property of gratitude/thankfulness/appreciation of $x_2$=$c_2$ for $x_3$=$c_3$ (event/property)
column3: It is implicitly assumed that ce'u is assigned to ckire1.

column2: $k_1$ is $c_1$'s expertise/prowess in/skill at/mastery of $c_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$
$x_1$ is the identity function/equality relation
column3: brivla form of ka ce'u du ma kau.

column2: $x_1$ is happiness experienced by $x_2$ about (event/state/idea) $x_3$
column3: Extension of $gleki_2$ to $x_3$ in order to include/accomodate idea type sumti.

column2: $x_1$ is (the quality of) luster/sheen/shininess/finish of $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
column3: In heraldry, characterizes the distinction between tinctures (metals and colours/dyes).

column2: $x_1$ is the life (property of being alive) of $x_2$.
column3: For the event of living, see {nunji'e}.

column2: $x_1$ is a society; $x_1$ is social
$x_1$ is the cleaniness/hygiene of $x_2$
$m_1$  tests/evaluates/measures $j_1$'s knowledge of facts (du'u)  $j_2$ in subject area $j_3$  as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$
column3: The x2 through x4 places are = m2.

column2: $k_1$=$b_1$ is a vertebra of $b_3$ ; $b_3$ is a vertebrate.
$x_1$ is a leek of variety $x_2$.
$kam_1$ is the health of $kan_1$ by standard $kan_2$.
$k_1$ is the majesty of $t_1$=$n_1$ being a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.
$x_1$ is wisdom of $x_2$ on matter $x_3$
$x_1$=$k_1$ is pleasure generated from event/state $x_2$=$p_1$ for experiencer $x_3$=$p_2$ under conditions $x_4$=$p_3$.
$k_1$  is the relation of $s_1$ to $s_2$.
$k_1$ is the fatigue of $t_1$ in being/doing $t_2$ (event).
$x_1$=$k_1$ is the tendency of $x_2$=$t_1$ to $x_3$=$t_2$
$k_1$ is the strength of $t_1$ in property/quality $t_2$ (ka).
$c_1$ is the childhood (state of being a child) of $v_1$.
$k_1$ is the power of $v_1$ in aspect $v_2$ under conditions $v_3$.

$x_1 = $ka$_1$ is handedness/chirality/stereoisomerism/property of being chiral which is exhibited by $x_2 = $xansa$_1$, the chirality having type/signature/manifestation $x_3 = $xansa$_2$, according to standard/rule/consideration $x_4 = $xansa$_3$ and under conditions $x_5 = $xansa$_4$.
$x_1$ pertains to the numerically lower/lesser/inferior side of $x_2$ under order relation/judging aspect $x_3$.
column3: See also: {kamyzmakezra'a} (the notes there apply here with appropriate analogs substituted).
column5: the lesser end;the numerically lower end

column2: $x_1$ is the least $x_2$ or in property $x_2$ (ka) among set/range $x_3$.
column3: {traji} allows for both extremities but defaults to the positive side/valence (resulting in its meaning "most" in that case); this word 'defaults' to the negative side/valence and does not even have an alternative.

column2: $x_1$ exhibits extremis/the property of (pertaining to) both being near and approaching the death of $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the quality of whom/what is free to do/be $x_2$=$z_2$; $x_1$ is freedom/liberty of $x_2$=$z_2$
$x_1$ pertains to the numerically higher/greater/superior side of $x_2$ under order relation/judging aspect $x_3$.
column3: For example, a Gaussian has two tails; the tail with the greater numbers (which is traditionally/conventionally plotted on the right side of a horizontally oriented scale) is kamyzmakezra'a. For another example, suprema and infima are the bounds on a set; suprema are bounds from (so-called) above - in other words, from the numerically greater side of the set in question. This word is used for every reference of saying "above", "upper", or "right" in the context of ordered numbers, since these terms are culturally-dependent. See also: {kamymeckezra'a}.
column5: the greater end;the numerically higher end

column2: $c_1$ is a quantity of Chèvre/goat cheese of variety/from goat $c_2$=$k_1$.
$ku_1$ is a goatherd/takes-care-of/attends to//is caretaker for animals $ku_2$=$ka_1$.
$x_1$ is January of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is alone in state/condition/enterprise $x_2$
$x_1$ lives/resides alone in $x_2$
$x_1$ feels togetherness towards $x_2$
$j_1$=$k_1$ is a watch (portable timepiece) measuring time units $j_2$ to precision $j_3$ with timing mechanism $j_4$.
$x_1$ happens sooner than expected by $x_2$
$x_1$ looks forward, is in joyful anticipation of $x_2$ (proposition) being the case.
$x_1$ happens later than expected by $x_2$
$x_1$ do $x_2$ together.
$x_1$ (du'u/si'o) is a connotation/undertone of $x_2$ (text or act of expression), recognized by $x_3$
$xa_1$=$k_1$ is a roommate of/lives with $k_2$ at location/habitat/nest/home/abode $x_3$=$xa_2$.
$s_1$=$k_1$ is sickly/appears healthy to observer $s_3$ by standard $k_2$.
$cikna_1$=$skapi_2$ experiences goose bumps.
$k_1$ is a skin pore of pelt/skin/hide/leather $k_2$=$s_1$ from $x_3$=$s_2$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a tattoo/body art/brand/[image on the body] depicting $x_2$=$p_2$ on animal/body part $x_3$=$s_2$ made by artist $x_4$=$p_3$
$c_1$ is a sandal for protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$x_1$=$c_1$=$k_2$ is a self-propelled artillery gun for use against $x_2$ by $x_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
$c_1$ is a car key opening/unlocking a lock of car $c_2$=$k_1$, and having relevant properties $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a vehicle horn, a klaxon
$x_1$ comes/goes to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via route $x_4$ using car $x_5$
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $m_1$ is a carport protecting car $m_2$=$k_1$ from $m_3$ (normally getting rained on or the like)
$x_1$ is the drive-thru/drive-through lane of restaurant $x_2$
$z_1$ is a garage for car $z_2$=$k_1$
$x_1$=$k_1$=$c_1$ is a key card unlocking lock $x_2$=$c_2$ by property/card type $x_3$=$c_3$
column3: Various types of cards include mechanical holes, bar code, magnetic stripe ({maksriveikarda}), Wiegand wire, microchip and RFID. Cf. {maksrikardymi'i}.
column5: bar code keycard;keycard;magnetic keycard;mechanical hole keycard;microchip keycard;RFID keycard;Wiegand wire keycard

column2: $x_1$ is a ray, skate, etc. (flat fish which is a relative of sharks) of taxon  $x_2$
column3: Colloquial; approximates taxon Batoidea, but focuses on the relative flatness and thinness of the individual (or what is typical for the species). In jocular English translation, this concept could be described as "pancake shark" or "flat shark".

column2: $f_1$ is in the genus Dorstenia, species $f_2$
$g_1$ opens portal/passage/entranceway $k_1$, permitting access to $k_2$ by $k_3$.
$x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd issue/number of journal/periodical/magazine/publication $x_2$ with content $x_4$ published by $x_5$ for audience $x_6$  .
$x_{1}$ is an open-break with broken piece $x_{2}$.
$j_1$=$k_3$ hatches from eggshell $j_2$=$p_1$=$k_1$

column3: Violated right $k_1$ (event) may be implied by x4. The harm/violation must be by sexual activity (what one would consider {gletu}) and must be sexual in nature. Need not be violent. Harm may not be physical or even psychological/mental/emotional; it need only be a 'harm to one's rights' (in other words, a violation of loi {krali}). {krali} is an experimental gismu.  The mutual symmetry of gle1 and gle2 is lost/broken by the harmer-victim relationship enforced by this word (and, specifically, xai1 and xai2=k2). See also: {glexai}, {xaigle}, {vilgle}, {glevlile}, {glevilxaigau}, {glekrali}, {glecu'akrali}, {glekralyxai}, {kralyxai}.

$x_1$ is ornamentation related to/composing/pertaining to/forming an element of interior design/room content arrangement/home decoration (including wall decorations, accent walls, and focus items/centerpieces) and/or structural design/blueprint for $x_2$ (particular room/structure) in larger structure (such as building) $x_3$, that is done for purely aesthetic (as opposed to functional) reasons
column3: This ornamentation may also be expressed through the design of the space itself (it's shape, etc.); thus the definition here is wider than {kumjoibimselvauja'i}, which is only the decoration of the room via the inclusion and arrangement of certain contents and coloring the walls. In other words: this word includes physical changes/renovations to or choices for a structure, which are relatively hard to perform, as well as the arrangement of the contents of its interior (which is easier and is the meaning of the alternative word).

column2: $x_1$ is ornamentation related to/composing/pertaining to/forming an element of interior design/room content arrangement/home decoration (including wall decorations, accent walls, and focus items/centerpieces), but not a structural design/blueprint, for $x_2$ (particular room/structure) in larger structure (such as building) $x_3$
column3: This is interior decoration. This is something that can be changed over the course of a weekend by a small number of people. It is a type of {kumjoibimja'i}.

column2: $x_1$ is cloisonné ornamentation on $x_2$ that exhibits cloisons/cloisters/compartments/cells/separated box regions (filled with/meant for) $x_2$ and with separating barriers $x_3$ (usually metal).
column3: The existence of actual raised barriers is important.  These are not just disparate and distinct regions touching one another and transitioning sharply across the interface (this would be the case murals, brickwork, art made from magnetic phase domains, etc.). The wall is an emphasized part of the decoration; in fact, it is thick and the compartments/cloison do not touch eachother. An additional layer of metal may be laid over top for added ornamentation.

Number suffix initiating a subordinate clause representing a predicate whose arity is the suffixed number; the lambda variables representing the predicate slots are bound from the ko'a-ko'u series in their dictionary ordering; the number of bound variables is the same as the predicate arity.
column3: For example, if the selected arity is two (re ky'oi), then only {ko'a} and {ko'e} are bound, and {ko'i} etc. are not bound. Terminator: {ku'au}.

The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.

column3: The grammar in question can itself be specified by metalinguistic tags that apply to the utterance; if not explicitly specified, then a cultural assumption/default is applied. This word is useful for distinguishing between, for example, differentiating between something that the speaker happens to call "PEMDAS" and the order of operations PEMDAS (which, presumably, could be included in the grammar as a special word that influences mekso interpretation); likewise for a font that happens to be called ".{mekrot}." ("math blackboard bold") and the one that definitely refers to the set of characters used for, among other purposes, set notation.

$x_1$ is a complex number (understood as such).
column3: Not necessarily strictly imaginary (or real, for that matter). This word relies on {xo'ei} to implicitly fill both sides of {ka'o}. See also: {ka'o'ai zei namcu}, {noka'ono} (with PA neither immediately before nor immediately after it), {nozeika'o zei namcu}, and {ka'ozeino zei namcu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a pure real number (such that its imaginary part is 0) understood as an example of a complex number.
column3: Includes 0 = (0,0) = 0 + 0i. This word relies on {xo'ei} implicitly filling the second slot of "{ka'o}" and also relies on the Cartesian decomposition of all complex numbers into real and imaginary bases (due to {ka'o}). It is important to note that this is isomorphic to a 'normal' real number but is not one; it is a complex number with imaginary part 0. See also: {ka'o zei namcu} and {nozeika'o zei namcu}.

$x_1$ (set, group, structure, category, class, etc.) has cardinality less than or equal to aleph-null; $x_1$ is mathematically countable (including the option of being finite).
column3: Purposefully designed as a zi'evla. $x_1$ is finite or countably infinite; there exists a bijection between (the set underlying) $x_1$ and a (not necessarily proper) subset of the set of all of the natural numbers. The empty set is finite. For "uncountable"/"uncountably infinite", use "{to'e} ({zei}) kancuka'e". See also: {cimni} / {tolcimni}.

$x_1$ (property with two places for ce'u) is the property according to which members of $x_2$ (ordered set with two members) are related to each other in the same way as members of $x_3$ (ordered set with two members), or in the same way as members of $x_4$ (ordered set with two members), etc. ... (infinite number of places)
column3: This is analogy; the terms in $x_2$ are related to one another in the same way as the terms in $x_i$, for any $i>1$, and that mutual relationship is that of $x_1$. The cardinality and order of the sumti filling every terbri except the first is determined by the number of {ce'u}'s in and the main selbri in abstraction of the first terbri. See also {kenmige}, {cenmige}

column2: $x_1$ (entity) cancels $x_2$ (event)

$x_1$ is a real number which belongs to the interval (0, 1), or it belongs to the set $x_2$ (contextless default: empty set), exactly.
column3: This word is good for "percentage" or "fraction" (one sense). It can be used in order to construct a lujvo for "continuum" (the interval (0,1)). Generically, no further restriction is placed upon $x_1$. In particular, it need not be rational. $x_2$ need not be a subset of the reals. However, in particular, $x_2 = Set(0,1)$ allows $x_1$ to belong to exactly $[0,1]$. $x_1$ belongs to no set which is not a subset of $(0,1) \cup x_2$.

column2: $x1$ is a boson (quantum wave-particle obeying  Bose–Einstein statistics) of type $x2$ in quantum state/with properties $x3$

$x_1$ is some canvas
column3: A piece of coarse cloth, woven from hemp, useful for making sails and tents or as a surface for paintings.

column2: $x_1$ is a complex number with real part $x_2$ and imaginary part $x_3$

$x_1$ and $x_2$ are elements of the same partially-ordered set $x_3$ (see notes) such that $x_1$ and $x_2$ cannot be meaningfully compared via said relation/in said property.
column3: Neither is more nor less than the other because those relations/concepts simply do not make sense for the given pair. $x_3$ accepts sumti of either of two types/structures: (1) a partially-ordered set in which both the underlying set and the order relation on it are specified explicitly (see: "{cmacistura}"); (2) a simple "ka" construct indicating a property or characteristic which roughly functions as the basis of an assumed partial-order relation on an unspecified or vague partially-ordered set, in a fashion which is grammatically approximately analogous to "{zmadu}"'s structure.

column2: $x_1$ [mass of properties describing skills, technological advances] is a civilization of $x_2$ (mass of persons) manifesting Type $x_3$ (number) on the Kardashev scale of technological advancement according to standard/particular scale/definition $x_4$.
column3: A Type I civilization can store all of the energy from $solri_1$ of its $kardacevo_2$. A Type II can harness the total energy of such $solri_1$. A Type III civilization can control energy on the scale of its entire host galaxy. See also {kulnu}, {tarso'imei}.

$x_1$ (collection, body, set, mass, tuple, n-some, etc.) is $x_2$ (li; default: 1) indivisible/atomic/elementary/basic discrete entities (or particles) of type $x_3$ in composition/content, by standard $x_4$; the count of instances of $x_3$ in $x_1$ is $x_2$ by standard $x_4$.
column3: Not an SI standard unit; dimensionality is 1 or, arguably, the same as the mole ("{molro}"); usually optional in practice. To be used for unit composition (such as count per unit time (see: )). $x_3$ values which are mutually distinct and not mutually heirarchically related/comparable produce orthogonality; for example: hydrogen atoms are counted separately from carbon atoms, but neither one is independent of the count of hydrocarbon compounds, in a given sample. Whether 'multiple' instances of mutually identical entities are each counted separately is defined by $x_4$ (where "multiple" here is not intended to bias interpretation or to be tautological). For the purposes of this word, the $x_3$-composition of $x_1$ should not be treated as a continuum. Actual/physical indivisibility need not be required; only conceptual and relevant indivisibility or basicness is required, and may be further explained or restricted via $x_4$. See also: "{kancu}", "{mei}", "{fei'u}".
column5: natural unit of counting discrete elementary entities

column2: $x_1$ (quantity) is a hair cleaning/care/maintenance/styling substance/product for purpose $x_2$ of composition $x_3$; $x_1$ is a quantity of hair product
column3: This word is something of an {u'ivla}. Not restricted to only shampoo (hair cleaning product); can include (but is not limited to): shampoo, conditioner, hair mousse/gel, hair replenisher/grower (for baldness), hair coloring dye, hair styling spray, and even shaving cream/foam; however, it should be a tool/substance applied to hair semi-permanently, rather than applied to it only initially in order to modify it for later (such as a crimper, curler, etc.)—in other words, kerfrcampu remains with the hair or is scrubbed in and then washed out in order to function. Hair need not be human, of the top of the head, or even "real"/biological/belonging to the individual in question—these characteristics may be specified by $x_2$. See also {krevelylu'i}; {campu} for gismu version of same word.

column3: Makes all tanru in the following text "selskiski"/"military-style": i.e. {tertau} come *before* {seltau}. This essentially puts {ke'oi} before every tanru. // This is an experimental cmavo in the truest sense of the word, used to test out "what if" Lojban chose "noun-adjective"  order, which does have several advantages (chief of them being that the selbri-unit that describes the subject is uttered first), despite being unusual for English speakers.

column2: mekso style converter: elementwise application of operator
column3: Prefixed to an operator/function that operates on numbers, thereby transforming it into a set operator (thus its arguments must be sets where before they were numbers), as defined in a given structure; the result is a function of the same arity. Produces the set of all numbers that are given by some ordered tuple of elements (the nth term of which belongs to the nth set specified, for all n) with the operator acting on them/the tuple (per the rules of that operator). The set produced may include empty terms and/or infinity. Let "@" represent the operator and "$x_i$" represent a set for all i; then $x_1$ kei'ai @ $x_2$ boi $x_3$ boi $x_4$ boi $\dots$ = Set(@$(t_1, t_2, t_3, t_4, \dots)$: $t_i$ in $x_i$ for all i); the ordered Cartesian product of the operands of 'kei'ai @' must be a subset of the domain set of '@'. If f is unitary and we convert it to a set operator 'kei'ai f' = F, then for any good set A, $F(A) = \operatorname{img}_f (A)$, which is the image of A under the function/map f.  See also {kei'au} for a similar but different word.
column5: difference set;image under f;set of results of operator;sum set

column2: mekso operator: finite result set derived from/on set A with/due to operator/function B under ordering of application C
column3: Equivalent to: lo'i li zy du ca'e li pe'o se'au mau'au B zai'ai vei ma'o xy boi ny ve'o boi tau sy boi C ku poi ke'a cmaci xanri zi'e poi ke'a mleca li ci'i zo'u tau sy klesi A. Acts on an operator/function (B) and produces all finite results of that operator being used on any allowable number of elements of the set A without repetition within any given application; the results cannot be used as operands unless they are in A, but they are still in the result set. In order to overcome this limitation, iteration can be used (else, this definition may need to be modified). The result must be defined (and finite, obviously). Application of the operator on nothing (the elements of the empty set) is generically allowed and follows convention (for example, an empty sum may evaluate to 0). Differs from {kei'ai}. Use {mau'au} and {zai'ai} for quoting B. C will be specified explicitly (possibly elsewhere) and/or via {zoi'ai}.
column5: finite result set;finite sum set;finite union set

column2: digit/number: hex digit E (decimal 14) [fourteen].
column3: Used as an alternative to {rei}/{xei} due to unique consonant. Useful in crowded situations. Experimental rafsi: -kim-

column2: non-logical connective/mekso operator - of arity only 1 xor 2: set (absolute) complement, or set exclusion (relative complement). Unary: $X_{2} ^{C}$; binary: ${X_1}\setminus{X_2}$.
column3: Each input must be a set or similar. The definition of the binary case expands to "the set of exactly those elements which are in $X_1$ but not in $X_2$". This word and operator has ordered input: '$X_1$ kei'i $X_2$' is not generally equivalent to '$X_2$ kei'i $X_1$'; in other words, the operator is not commutative. If unary (meaning that $X_1$ is not explicitly specified in a hypothetical expression "${X_1}\setminus{X_2}$"), then $X_1$ is taken to be some universal set $O$ in/of the discourse (of which all other mentioned or relevantly formable sets are subsets, at the least); in this latter case, the word operates as the set (absolute) complement of the explicitly mentioned set here designated as $X_2$ for clarity (id est: the output is $O\setminus{X_2}={X_2}^{C}$, where "$^{C}$" denotes the set absolute complement; in other words, it is the set of all elements which may be under consideration such that they are not elements of the explicitly specified set). When binary with both $X_1$ and $X_2$ explicitly specified, this word/operator is the set relative complement. This word is somewhat analogous to, depending on its arity, logical 'NOT' or 'AND NOT' (just as set intersection is analogous to logical 'AND', set union is analogous to logical '(AND/)OR'  and set symmetric difference is analogous to 'XOR'). The preferred description/name in English is "set (theoretic) exclusion". See also: "{kleivmu}". For reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complement_(set_theory) .
column5: \;absolute complement;C;exclusion;relative complement;set complement;set difference;set exclusion;set minus;set subtraction

column2: vocative: please repeat in simpler words.
reverses modification order of contained tanru (does not affect lujvo).
column3: Marks a "selskiski"/"military-style"/"noun-adjective" tanru, i.e. {tertau} come *before* {seltau}. This differs from {co} in that it does not affect the place structure of the sumti to the right; i.e. in {mi ke'oi broda brode do} (= {mi brode broda do}), both {mi} and {do} are arguments of {broda}. Default grouping is still left: {lo ke'oi ckule nixli cmalu melbi} resolves to {lo ke'oi (((ckule nixli) cmalu) melbi)}, which is equivalent to {lo melbi ke cmalu ke nixli ckule}. {co} does not (re-)reverse the order of tanru-modification; it only changes place structure. See {ke'e'u}.
